alert.note: Alert for Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 6:54AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN LE FLORE COUNTY... At 653 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 6 miles southwest of Mountain Fork, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Le Flore County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
